title: NEVER tell ANYONE to refund their skin...
body:
That is by far one of the meanest things you can do, other than telling someone to kill themselves.
First of all, people have bad games. Second, people can buy a skin because they want to and they like it. Third, this game is about FUN, not WINNING AND BEING THE BEST AND TAKING DOWN TEAMMATES BECAUSE THEY FEED A KILL OR MAKE A STUPID PLAY!

When I was about level 20, someone told me to refund my snowday sivir skin. I really took it to heart and it actually upset me (granted they were doing a lot of other stuff, but this is after all the topic on hand). I ended up refunding it and I actually stopped playing Sivir, even though she was my favorite champion at the time. Only recently (over a year and a half later) have I started to play sivir again, and I regret letting someone get to me.

Seriously, people have bad games, and skins =/= skill. Don't be a dick.
It is like saying that you can not wear your clothes because you don't know how to make them.
Just to jump in, I believe it'd be closer to saying you can't wear your clothes because you don't know where they go. e.g. Don't wear a hat if you're going to put it on your ass.

{{champion:33}} ok

Having someone for example, a rich brat buying Spirit Guard Udyr & went 0/15/4 because he has never played him before, is similar to how someone who got his first driving license purchased an expensive Ferrari & crashes it 2 minutes later.

I may be salty, but yes, I sometimes indeed say "refund your skin" if they clearly don't know what they're doing.

Still don't think that's justified.
He bought the skin to look nice, not because he was necessarily good at the champion.
A player's monetary reserves or how expensive a skin is shouldn't play into your judgement either. You could have a rich brat playing Deadly Kennen and doing poorly, and you could have a not-so-rich kid playing Blade Queen Lissandra and doing poorly--it doesn't matter. They bought the skins because they liked them, and you shouldn't demean them for that.

Also, people have off games. People get screwed by matchmaking. People have lag.
That doesn't mean you should tell them off, especially by saying "refund your skin".
I've reported people on my friends list for saying things like this. Simply because it's a pretty slimy thing to do - I don't care who you are.

I stopped playing with a few irl friends who were toxic in-game. It's just not pleasant seeing them poison the experience of everyone else.

I can't bring myself to do the same. A select few people are immune to reports from me and I don't have any real "IRL" friends so it's hard for me to just not play with them. That's not to say they don't deserve it. I just can't bring myself to do it. I have, however, called them out on the matter privately so they very much know where I stand on the situation.

Come to think of it, I owe this game a lot more than I realize considering the small circle of friends I do have, I met on here.

Usually toxicity is correlated to tilt I find, so remaining positive and deescalating situations can help. Hopefully you're successful in changing their behaviour :)
